channel.title: music on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in music on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: The Relevance of Culture
item.description: A conversation with an old friend of mine revealed to me that the word culture is too often associated only with religion and ritualism and dismissed as irrelevant.

item.title: LOG 3.7 Of rain and coming home
item.description: 19th June 2013 The sound, smell and sight of a storm are reassuring and comforting to me. I sit here thousands of miles away listening to Ghanana ghanana from Lagaan for a moment transported to Bangalore.

item.title: LOG 3.4: Munich
item.description: Hello, Happy Pillayaar Chathurthi (festival for Ganesha- the elephant headed god) to you and your families ðŸ™‚ I just got back from lunch with my Indian friends.

item.title: LOG 3.3: To love a guitar
item.description: 6th August, 2012 Hello! Hope you are doing well. I sang in the Vorspiel Abend (Performance evening) with my rapper friend, Sven. I was nervous but it went well.

item.title: LOG 2.7: Acapella Abend
item.description: 13th February, 2012 Hello, Europe is getting hit by a cold wave. Last two weeks were pretty severe in places like Ukraine, Poland etc. Oldenburg sunk below 0C and only today it has risen above to a measley 3.

item.title: LOG 2.6: Solistice
item.description: 23rd December, 2011 Hello ðŸ™‚ It is Winter here but there has been only scanty snowfall which secretly fell in the night and looked like frosty icing in the morning, quickly melting away.

item.title: LOG 2.5: Smooth
item.description: 28th November 2011 Hi! How are you all ðŸ™‚ Life cruises smoothly by. A bit too fast; weeks whizz by at an incredible pace. Work is moving smoothly, social life is fun and uncomplicated ðŸ™‚

item.title: LOG 2.4: Time of my life :)
item.description: Hello everyone, It has been an unreasonable amount of time since I last wrote. More than a month! And so many things can happen in a month.

item.title: LOG 1.19: Sunsets
item.description: 2nd June, 2011 Hello, This will be a short one. MATLAB week is going surprisingly well and Iâ€™m learning a lot without getting frustrated. Only tomorrow left and I find that it has been an easier one than most others.

item.title: LOG 1.17: Oh wow, Barcelona!
item.description: 11th May, 2011 Ola everyone ðŸ™‚ I have successfully recovered to a state of normalcy after the most amazing and exhausting weekend I can ever remember having!

item.title: LOG 1.15: Rise and Fall
item.description: 22nd April, 2011 Jananiâ€™s log; Solar date: 220411.12 Last week I had crammed too many activities into my schedule; attending multiple classes, working on the programming, in aerobics, music group and a Greenpeace meeting.

item.title: Spiritual, religious or philosophical?
item.description: Many people confuse spirituality with religiousness, and philosophy with spirituality. Here I will attempt to tease out the differences as I see them. To be religious is to follow a given set of rules generally defined by an existing system of organised faith.

item.title: LOG 1.8: Missing English and The Tree of Gondor
item.description: 11th February, 2011 Hello all, I got a mobile and landline connection. From my home number I can call landlines all over europe for free! So if you are in Europe, let me know your number and we can have a little phone chat ðŸ™‚

item.title: Vaasam Ella Malar Ithu
item.description: The nusic for this song was composed by T Rajendar and anthother person. It was their first movie, called Oru Thalai Raagam, meaning one sided raagam, implying unrequitted love.

item.title: A Sleep Deprived Mind
item.description: I woke up early and worked all day. Had very little lunch but instead of eating dinner at eight pm as I normally do, I went to sing with my friends until around eleven thirty in the night.

item.title: The Wait
item.description: March 2009 She waited at the coffee shop. The shadows lengthened and the new March leaves caught the evening light. Music played unnecessarily loudly in the background.

item.title: Adult
item.description: 25th May 2007 I suddenly realize I am a machine. I do the same things everyday. Iâ€™ve stopped feeling. Iâ€™ve stopped thinking. Iâ€™m too busy with my life.

item.title: Chopin's Nostalgia: Ballade No. 2 in F Major op. 38
item.description: Chopin has always been the most real sound track of my life. I got to know some of his most popular pieces as a nine year old in Australia when Readerâ€™s Digest sent the CD for my mum.

item.title: LfE 14: Traveling to Slough
item.description: 15/12/2009 Hello everyone! Hope this letter finds you all in good health. My adventures are more mobile now. Iâ€™m on the train to Slough to visit family for the holidays.

item.title: Poongaathu Thirumbuma? Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a relatively old song. The lyrics are in rustic Tamil style. Melody by Ilayaraja. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ujkKvIpyfY **Poongaathu thirumbuma? Yaen paatte virumbuma? Paaraate, madiyil vaichu thaalaate,

item.title: Poove Sempoove: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Here is another Ilayaraja song. A melody from Solla Thudikuthu Manasu. **poovae sempoovae un vaasam varum vaasal en vaasal un poongaavanam vaay paesidum pullaanguzhal needhaanoru poovin madal**

item.title: LfE 9: Halloween and the True Colours of the Weather
item.description: 01/11/2009 Hello everyone! My cough is completely gone. It took its own time and I waited patiently ðŸ™‚ Last night was Halloween. We were out all night partying.

item.title: Naan Malarodu Thaniyaga- Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a sweet romantic song from the â€™60s. Thanks to my dad for making sense of the last verse! **nAn malarOdu thaniyAga yEn ingu ninREn

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 2
item.description: **13/09/2009 THE BEGINNING: PART 2** Hello! I just got back from a great time at three events. I climbed Arthurâ€™s Seat and made a friend (Greek) whoâ€™s about to start studying Bachelors of Computer science and met a Londoner who studies Geology.

item.title: Uyire en Uyire: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: For a change, this is a more recent song. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7qMTUVkahjU **M: Uyire en uyire ennavo nadakuthadi Adada intha nodi valvil inikuthadi Oh oru nimidam oru nimidam enai nie piriyathe

item.title: Mannil Intha Kadal (Breathless) â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This song is from the movie Keladi Kanmani. A widower is bringing up a child and when he meets one of her teachers, they begin to fall in love.

item.title: Understanding India using Europe
item.description: It is too difficult for a European to see India as one country when they understand itâ€™s diversity is more at the scale of a continent â€“ their continent.

item.title: Kaadhalin Deepam â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a melodious potential Ohrwurm which describes how he is falling in love. As it seems to be typical of the time period in which this movie was made, the choreography is weird, their expressions seem more contemplative or sad than joyful and the costume design is odd but the song sounds good.

item.title: Pachai Niramae: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: The lyrics of this song uses vivid imagery of colours to describe love and the woman he is in love with. The song begins with him shouting out in joy that she smiled at him.

item.title: Yamunai Aatrile â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: A beautiful song from Thalapathi. **Yamunai atrile ira katrile Kannanodu than aada Parvai poothida padhai parthida Pavai radhaiyo vada** In Yamuna river, in the moist air,

item.title: Uyire Uyire â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: From the movie Bombay, this is another super-hit from Rahman. Hariharanâ€™s voice makes it take on a etheral quality. And if I may say so, these lyrics far out-beat the Hindi remake.

item.title: Swasame â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: From Thenali, another Kamal Movie (:)), this clip starts with her singing to him and he tells her that it would be better to sing a duet in their dreams (unobserved by street people) so they can change location and clothes as they please (as it typical of movie songs).

item.title: Vaseegara â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This song was a big hit when it first came out and still is very popular. It is from the movie Minnile which means lightning. It is considered a sensual song and therefore it must have some strange dance scenes in the middle to leave the real sensual things to imagination if you be so inclined.

item.title: Oraayiram Paarvayile Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Iâ€™ve always found this song very hauntingly romantic. **Nooru murai piranthaalum nooru murai iranthaalum Unai pirinthu vegu thooram naan oru naalum povathillai Ulagaththin kanngalile uruvangal marainthaalum

item.title: Adho Andha Paravai Pola â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: When I was a child in Australia, someone choreographed an amazing dance for this song. I still remember a lot of it. Go MGR! ðŸ™‚

item.title: Pani Vizhum Malar Vanam â€“ Lyrics and translation
item.description: The dance is ridiculous in this video but the song is good. Thanks to my dad for correcting the meanings. They make a lot more sense now ðŸ™‚ .

item.title: Mayakkama Kalakkama â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Another classic oldie of more philosophical nature. We donâ€™t get these anymore. Thanks to my dad for correcting the meanings. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VcW2G5SLjBw **Mayakkamaa kalakkamaa Manadhilae kuzhappamaa

item.title: Anthi Mazhai Lyrics and Translations
item.description: I think by now it is quite easy to tell I am a big fan of Kamal Hassan. His acting is so versatile, it truly is a pity that just because of the language and/or a cultural barrier, the rest of the world is missing out.

item.title: Balailakka Balailakka â€“ Lyrics and Translation (with end notes)
item.description: A.R. Rahman had another party with this movie. He has explored several new styles including hip pop in the movie Shivaji â€“ The Boss. Although it has some lines just for the sake of rhyming lyrics(I will mark these with a â€˜*â€™), this song makes me long for home.

item.title: Pon Maalai Pozhudu Lyrics and Translation
item.description: One of Ilayrajaâ€™s most popular pieces. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hymujdC0mlw **Pon maaalaip pozhuthu Idhu oru pon maalaip pozhudhu Vaanamagal naanugiraal vaeru udai poonugiraal (Idhu oru)** Golden evening time

item.title: Athisaya Raagam Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This raagam, called Mahati, has only 4 notes. In Karnatic music, all raagams have either 5, 6 or 7 notes. But Balamurali Krishna invented this one and was critisised for his non-traditional innovation.

item.title: Kanne Kalaimaane Lyrics and Translation
item.description: In this song, Kamalâ€™s character is singing to Srideviâ€™s character. The story of Moondraam Pirai is about a troubled young man who finds a mentally ill girl about to be sold for the first time in a brothal.

item.title: Thakita Thadimi (Salangai Oli) Lyrics Translated
item.description: I recommend this beautiful movie to everyone. In this song, the uber-talented dancer has become an alcoholic and he sings and dances referring to the past he shares with the widow who is watching him.

item.title: Tamil Songs Translated
item.description: Tamil Songs Translated is an archive where all Tamil songs I have translated can be found.Â Why donâ€™t you take a look now? Categories/Lyrics Translations[

item.title: Prologue
item.description: They are my songs. You are my song Yet I wander like untied.
